alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:53PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Clay and northeastern Dunklin Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 153 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Naylor, or 9 miles northwest of Corning, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malden, Piggott, Corning, Campbell, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Reyno, St. Francis, Pollard, McDougal, Success, Datto, Glennonville, Saint Francis, Hickoria, Twin Oaks, Palatka, Heelstring, Valley Ridge and Chalk Bluff Battlefield Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
